Sure, here are 5 use cases in Earth Observation that are required today by the end users in Emergency management and humanitarian market segment, and that these use cases can make revenues for a startup:

1. Disaster Response and Damage Assessment: EO data can help in disaster response and damage assessment by providing real-time information on the extent of the disaster, the number of people affected, and the damage to critical infrastructure. This information can be used by disaster response teams and humanitarian organizations to plan and execute relief efforts.
2. Food Security and Agriculture Monitoring: EO data can be used for monitoring crop health, detecting pests and diseases, and predicting crop yields. This information can be used by governments, NGOs, and farmers to improve food security and increase agricultural productivity.
3. Refugee and Migration Monitoring: EO data can be used for monitoring refugee and migration movements, including tracking migration routes, identifying safe havens, and assessing the living conditions of refugees. This information can be used by governments and humanitarian organizations to plan and execute relief efforts.
4. Disease Outbreak Monitoring: EO data can be used for monitoring disease outbreaks, including detecting the spread of diseases, identifying high-risk areas, and assessing the impact of interventions. This information can be used by governments and healthcare organizations to plan and execute disease control measures.
5. Conflict and Crisis Monitoring: EO data can be used for monitoring conflicts and crises, including identifying areas of conflict, monitoring troop movements, and assessing the impact of conflict on critical infrastructure. This information can be used by governments and humanitarian organizations to plan and execute relief efforts.
